intro: Galium nigroramosum, commonly known as black-stemmed bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its stems are often covered in fine hairs and may turn a dark purple or blackish color as they mature. Galium nigroramosum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
